scenarios.action: Cities are enacting laws and installing barriers to prevent homeless people from camping in public. What do you do?

options.reaction: Let cities and states deal with their own problems
Provide funding to build new shelters
Implement UBI to cover basic expenses like housing
Designate specific parks as free camp sites
Send the National Guard to help cities
Offer nationwide social services for homeless people

scenarios.action: Record-breaking heat waves are spreading across the country. What do you do?

options.reaction: Pass a law to require air conditioning in all buildings
Enact a carbon tax to punish consumers
Drag an iceberg from the Arctic to cool off America
Inject sulphur dioxide into the atmosphere
Encourage at-risk individuals to stay indoors
Introduce a color-coding system for heat warnings

scenarios.action: Traffic jams on various interstates are causing delays and frustration for drivers. What do you do?

options.reaction: Widen existing interstates
Add autobahn-style lanes with no speed limits
Add carpooling lanes
Add tolls to the most affected interstates
Build new interstates to take excess traffic
Build a cross-country bullet train system

scenarios.action: A drought has reduced American agricultural output, driving up grocery store prices. What do you do?

options.reaction: Invest in indoor climate-controlled farming
Temporarily ban exporting American food
Ask farmers to switch to more resilient crops
Build desalination plants to provide more water
Put price controls on grocery stores
Invest in cloud seeding technology to make it rain more

scenarios.action: A major bridge collapses, cutting off important land and water shipping routes. What do you do?

options.reaction: Provide emergency funds to rapidly build a new bridge
Reroute land traffic to reopen the waterway
Rebuild the bridge normally
Sue the corporations involved in the collapse

scenarios.action: A train carrying toxic chemicals derails near a small town, spilling its contents into the environment. What do you do?

options.reaction: Evacuate the affected area during cleanup
Allow residents to sue the rail company
Enact new rail safety and speed regulations
Let the town handle the situation themselves

scenarios.action: Entrepreneurs and investors are prospering. Their businesses are boosting the economy and creating jobs, but are also widening the wealth gap. What do you do?

options.reaction: Reduce the capital gains tax to incentivize reinvesting profits
Increase the capital gains tax to reduce the wealth gap and fund social programs
Make it easier for international entrepreneurs to immigrate to America
Create a national startup incubator so more Americans can try to start a business

scenarios.action: Inflation has been running wild, and people are getting frustrated with seemingly ever-rising prices for day-to-day items. What do you do?

options.reaction: Bring back the gold standard
Raise interest rates to cool off the economy
Set a legal limit on price increases for essential items
Require companies to give employees yearly raises which at least match inflation
Do nothing

scenarios.action: The birth rate in the U.S. has fallen below the necessary level to maintain population size. What do you do?

options.reaction: Offer tax incentives to parents to encourage having more kids
Increase immigration to offset the lower birth rate
Ban contraceptives nationwide
Provide housing rebates to young married adults to reduce financial stress
Allow the U.S. population to shrink

scenarios.action: Universities are reporting that high school students are not being adequately prepared for college. What do you do?

options.reaction: Invest in teacher training and development at public schools
Expand charter school systems
Encourage privatization of schools
Reduce class sizes for more personalized instruction
Implement strict education standards for standardized testing organizations

scenarios.action: Electric vehicles are increasing in popularity and EV owners demand more charging stations nationwide. What do you do?

options.reaction: Offer tax incentives to gas stations who install charging stations
Allocate government funds to build public charging infrastructure
Let private companies figure out standardization and installation
Encourage consumers to buy combustion or hybrid cars
Offer rebates on mini gasoline generators for EV owners

scenarios.action: The fast-food industry is booming, but concerned citizens are worried about the health effects of eating it regularly. What do you do?

options.reaction: Implement a tax on fast food and sugary drinks
Ban half the ingredients used, European style
Implement stricter nutritional labeling laws
Fund public health campaigns about healthy eating
Let consumers make their own choices

scenarios.action: The rise of online shopping giants is causing small businesses to struggle. What do you do?

options.reaction: Offer small business grants to local retailers
Prohibit online retail platforms from accessing merchant sales data
Run ads encouraging consumers to shop locally
Allow the market to self-regulate

scenarios.action: Celebrity influence in politics is growing, with many celebrities running for office. What do you do?

options.reaction: Hire a Zoomer social media intern with a broccoli haircut to make you go viral
Bribe political celebrities to endorse you instead
Create a reality TV show for traditional politicians to reach the masses
Run ads focusing on their lack of political experience

scenarios.action: A foreign government is suspected of using social media bots to influence elections. What do you do?

options.reaction: Impose economic sanctions on that country
Provide funding to social media platforms for bot detection and removal
Run your own propaganda bots to counteract any foreign influence
Fine social media companies who fail to remove foreign propaganda bots

scenarios.action: The rise of remote work is reducing traffic to business districts, harming local businesses and collapsing commercial property value. What do you do?

options.reaction: Override city zoning to let owners turn offices into housing & nightlife
Force companies to require at least 50% of employees be onsite
Subsidize downtown businesses to help them survive
Refuse to interfere with the property market

scenarios.action: Reports of a mysterious creature in a national park have gone viral. Some are claiming it to be a werewolf or a chupacabra. What do you do?

options.reaction: Fund a scientific expedition to find the creature
Dismiss the reports as hoaxes, saying it was probably just a stray dog
Use the creature as a mascot for national park funding
Offer a reward for credible footage of the creature
Create a themed restaurant in the park based on the mystery
Offer the creature tree fiddy to see if it is actually the Loch Ness monster

scenarios.action: Plastic garbage is building up in landfills across the nation, and is becoming difficult to manage. What do you do?

options.reaction: Nothing, there is plenty of space for cities to build new landfills
Build incinerators at power stations to convert garbage into electricity
Pay other nations to accept shipments of plastic garbage
Invest in biodegradable hemp-based alternatives to plastic
Expand recycling programs at the request of the plastic industry
Ban single-use plastics
Dump it in the ocean

scenarios.action: The Supreme Court publishes a series of decisions that you and your supporters strongly dislike. What do you do?

options.reaction: Try to appoint additional justices who are loyal to your views
Voice your opinion but reaffirm the independence of the Court
Pass laws to try to limit the effects of these rulings
Give gifts to some of the justices so that they align with you in the future

scenarios.action: A small nearby nation discovers a massive supply of oil that is cheap to extract in their territory, crashing oil prices. What do you do?

options.reaction: Embrace the cheaper oil prices for the benefit of American industry
Offer them military protection in exchange for exclusive drilling rights
Impose tariffs to protect American oil companies
Annex the country to get their oil supply
